newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Bilfinger unit to build Mekong bridge.
newsitem.headline: Bilfinger unit to build Mekong bridge.

text.p: Australian firm Baulderstone Hornibrook Engineering has been chosen to build a A$83 million (US$64 million) bridge over the lower Mekong River in Vietnam, the two governments said on Wednesday.
Baulderstone Hornibrook is a unit of German construction group Bilfinger + Berger Bau Ag.
The bridge, the first across the Mekong in Vietnam, is being partly funded by A$59 million of Australian aid and is due to be completed in late 2000.

"Along with its development benefits, the project will involve a high level of technology transfer and training of a large number of Vietnamese engineers and managers," Australian Forigin Minister Alexander Downer said in a statement.
The 1.4 kilometre (0.87 mile) bridge would eventually replace a ferry service that daily carries 22,500 people, 4,000 tonnes of freight and 5,000 passenger vehicles.
